column4: so ive got ubuntu all set up but now i dont know what to do with it
i normally use ableton live and cool edit pro
you won't find anything like ableton in linux, i'm afraid. rosegarden and ardour are the best audio enthusiast/pro level software really
muse's pretty good as well in features, but it's very much unfinished and useless in usability
i geuss ubuntu will just be my porn os

although the whole jackd based architechture in the proper linux audio apps is pretty nice. extremely low latencies and free routing of inputs and outputs, a bit like what you get done between different proprietary applications in mac and windows as well
only that they only need to support jackd, not a zillion different of these proprietary routing standards :)
i looked at ardour but it only records
although it does support automation through midi, even control surfaces
rosegarden is a reasonably good sequencer
